item.title: REA 称 Rightmove 拒绝了 56 亿英镑的收购要约
item.description: 澳大利亚房地产上市服务提供商 REA Group Ltd. 称，其向英国 Rightmove Plc 提出的 56 亿英镑（73 亿美元）收购要约遭到了该公司的拒绝。【原文：Australian real estate listing provider REA Group Ltd. said its £5.6 billion ($7.3 billion) takeover offer for Rightmove Plc was rejected by the UK company.】

item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事亚洲
item.description: 早上好摩根大通（JPMorgan）领衔的银行业前景黯淡。美股反弹。债券投资者看到了新的风险。市场动态如下。【原文：Good morning. JPMorgan led banks in dimming outlooks. US stocks rally. Bond investors see a new risk. Here’s what’s moving markets. —Isabelle Lee】

item.title: 全球需求担忧引发油价暴跌后石油出现反弹
item.description: 石油在跌至 2021 年底以来的最低收盘价后小幅反弹，一个行业组织指出美国库存再次下降。【原文：Oil staged a modest rebound after collapsing to its lowest close since late 2021, with an industry group flagging another drop in US stockpiles.】

item.title: 新加坡将允许赌场无现金投注，加密货币除外：新加坡通讯社
item.description: 据中新社援引新加坡内政与社会家庭发展部国务部长孙雪玲的话报道，根据对《赌场管制法》的修改，新加坡将允许其两家赌场进行无现金博彩，但不允许使用加密货币。【原文：Singapore will allow its two casinos to conduct cashless gaming under changes made to the Casino Control Act, but will not permit the use of cryptocurrencies, CNA reported, citing Minister of State for Home Affairs and for Social and Family Development Sun Xueling.】

item.title: 亚马逊将在英国投资 80 亿英镑，继续 AWS 扩张计划
item.description: 亚马逊公司（Amazon.com Inc. ）表示，将在英国斥资 80 亿英镑（105 亿美元）发展云计算业务，这是该公司近期在欧洲一系列扩张举措的补充，也为英国新一届工党政府带来了可喜的投资推动力。【原文：Amazon.com Inc. said it would spend £8 billion ($10.5 billion) in the UK to grow its cloud business, adding to a string of recent expansion moves in Europe and giving Britain’s new Labour government a welcome investment boost.】

item.title: 美联储就降息规模展开辩论，美国 CPI 将再次呈现低调增长
item.description: 预测人员预计，美国消费者物价月度报告将再次显示美国消费者物价增长乏力，这可能会引发美联储关于降息幅度的争论。【原文：Forecasters expect a monthly report on US consumer prices to show another month of muted increases, possibly playing into a Federal Reserve debate over how much to cut interest rates.】

item.title: 行为不端的交易员令澳新银行清理工作举步维艰
item.description: 早上好，我是乔治，我在悉尼为您带来今早的头条新闻......今日必读：- 违规交易员令澳新银行难以清理- 消费者信心下滑- REA向Rightmove提出收购建议【原文：Good morning, it’s Georgie here in Sydney with this morning’s top news for you...Today’s must-reads:• Misbehaving traders make ANZ clean-up tough• Consumer confidence slips• REA approaches Rightmove with takeover proposal】

item.title: 亚洲股市关注跌势；石油在暴跌后上涨：市场综述
item.description: 周三亚洲股市开盘疲软，此前美国科技股上涨抵消了金融股的下滑。在推动大宗商品指数跌至三年多来最低点后，原油重拾升势。【原文：Asian stocks are set for a weak open Wednesday after gains in US tech firms countered a slump in financial shares. Oil regained some ground after driving a commodities index to its lowest in more than three years.】

item.title: Blackstone 出售第二笔商业抵押债券为收购提供资金
item.description: Blackstone Inc. 将出售 10.5 亿美元的商业抵押债券，以帮助支付其 4 月份达成的收购公寓业主 AIR Communities 的交易。【原文：Blackstone Inc. is selling $1.05 billion of commercial mortgage bonds to help pay for a deal it struck in April to acquire AIR Communities, an apartment landlord.】

item.title: 中国行不通的住房救援数学正在延长危机时间
item.description: 今年 5 月，中国中央政府敦促 200 多个城市购买未售出的住房，以缓解供过于求的局面。三个多月后，只有 29 个城市响应了这一号召。【原文：In May, China’s central government urged more than 200 cities to buy unsold homes to ease oversupply. More than three months later, only 29 have heeded the call.】

item.title: 分众金融在 8 月取消交易后为贷款和债券定价
item.description: 由于 8 月初的全球市场动荡，焦点金融合伙公司（Focus Financial Partners Inc.【原文：Focus Financial Partners Inc. priced a combined $4.35 billion of leveraged loans and junk bonds Tuesday, a month after postponing a planned loan deal due to early August’s global market tumult.】

item.title: 美国大选或将提振日本住宅建筑商业绩
item.description: 与美国有业务往来的日本住房相关公司的股票可能会受益于总统大选和降息，从而领先于东京股市的大盘。【原文：Shares of Japanese housing-related companies with exposure to the US may benefit from the presidential election and interest rate cuts, keeping them ahead of the broader equity market in Tokyo.】

item.title: 丰业银行称历史性债券交易失败是财务模型错误所致
item.description: 据新斯科舍银行（Bank of Nova Scotia）的分析师称，为一家投资集团购买天然气管道提供资金的 10 亿加元（7.35 亿美元）债券交易因财务模型错误而告吹。【原文：A C$1 billion ($735 million) bond deal to finance an investment group’s purchase of gas pipelines fell apart due to a financial-modeling mistake, according to analysts at Bank of Nova Scotia.】

item.title: Kakao 创始人的审判融合了 Kpop、亿万富翁和市场：问与答
item.description: 周三，Kakao 公司创始人出庭受审，他将被指控在收购 K-pop 大公司 SM 娱乐公司期间操纵价格，这是韩国互联网和媒体行业的分水岭。【原文：Kakao Corp.’s founder goes on trial Wednesday to face allegations of rigging prices during the takeover battle for K-pop powerhouse SM Entertainment Co., a watershed moment for South Korea’s internet and media industries.】

item.title: 戴尔称将继续裁员，利润率面临压力
item.description: 戴尔科技公司（Dell Technologies Inc. ）今年将继续裁员，试图控制成本，因为人们担心个人电脑的需求没有反弹，而且为人工智能优化的服务器的销售利润不如其他产品。【原文：Dell Technologies Inc. will continue to reduce its workforce this year, trying to control costs amid concerns that demand for PCs hasn’t rebounded and sales of servers optimized for artificial intelligence aren’t as profitable as other products.】

item.title: 交易员仍认为美联储至少有两次大规模减息即将到来
item.description: 美国利率期权市场的交易商仍在押注美联储今年至少会有一次超大规模的降息，只是可能不会在11月5日美国大选之前。【原文：Traders in the US interest-rate options market are still betting on at least one super-sized Federal Reserve interest-rate cut this year — just probably not before the Nov. 5 US election.】

item.title: Corebridge 预计替代品的长期回报率为 8%至 9
item.description: Corebridge Financial Inc.首席执行官凯文-霍根（Kevin Hogan）表示，他预计该公司 55 亿美元的另类投资组合将产生 8%至 9%的长期收益，尽管最近几个季度未达到这一目标。【原文：Corebridge Financial Inc. Chief Executive Officer Kevin Hogan said he expects the firm’s $5.5 billion alternative investment portfolio to generate longer-term gains of 8% to 9%, despite falling short of that target in recent quarters.】

item.title: 日本央行削减债券购买量为日本投资者开辟新机遇
item.description: 随着日本央行放慢购债速度，当地投资者却反其道而行之，限制了债券收益率的上升压力。【原文：As the Bank of Japan slows debt purchases, local investors are doing just the opposite, limiting upward pressure on bond yields.】

item.title: 大选在即，特朗普媒体选项成本飙升，锁定期即将结束
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的媒体公司的股票期权成本已飙升至自 3 月份开始交易以来最昂贵的水平，因为交易员们都在为大选相关的波动性和内幕交易锁定期的结束做准备。【原文：The cost of options on shares of Donald Trump’s media company has surged to the most expensive since it first started trading in March as traders brace for election-related volatility and the end of a lockup period on insider sales.】

item.title: 如果回报落后于现金，ExodusPoint 将为客户提供更低的费用
item.description: ExodusPoint 资本管理公司（ExodusPoint Capital Management）为客户提供了一个机会，如果其基金在一年内的表现不优于三个月期国债，则无需支付业绩费用。【原文：ExodusPoint Capital Management is giving clients the chance to pay no performance fee if its fund doesn’t fare better than three-month Treasuries over the course of a year.】

item.title: GameStop 在销售下滑的情况下仍实现意外盈利
item.description: GameStop 公司连续第四个季度销售额下滑，但这家视频游戏零售商却意外实现了盈利。【原文：GameStop Corp. reported a fourth consecutive quarter of falling sales, though the video-game retailer reported an unexpected profit.】

item.title: 加拿大皇家银行麦凯称加拿大正走在 "错误的道路上"，需要进行税制改革
item.description: 加拿大皇家银行高层表示，加拿大的经济政策已经偏离了轨道，它需要一个更具竞争力的税收制度和与美国更紧密的关系。【原文：Royal Bank of Canada’s top executive said the country’s economic policy has veered off track, and it needs a more competitive tax regime and a tighter relationship with the US.】

item.title: 波哥大在长达数月的缺水问题上再添停电风险
item.description: 哥伦比亚首都自 4 月以来一直实行配给供水，现在可能不得不重新加强限制。【原文：Colombia’s capital, which has been rationing water since April and may have to re-tighten restrictions, is now also at risk of power cuts amid delays in building new transmission corridors.】

item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.【原文：The downside risk to the US dollar posed by the Federal Reserve’s coming interest-rate cuts is limited because other central banks are easing policy, too, according to an analyst from Goldman Sachs Group Inc.】

item.title: 摩根大通引领银行前景黯淡，破坏了规则上的胜利
item.description: 美国银行在新的资本规则方面从监管机构那里获得了重大突破，但却因为贷款前景不乐观而破坏了自己的庆祝活动。【原文：US banks scored a big break from regulators on new capital rules — only to ruin their own celebration with downbeat outlooks on lending.】

item.title: Big Lots 的银行和潜在买家讨论其 7.6 亿美元的出价
item.description: 折扣零售商 Big Lots Inc. 的贷款方正在与 Nexus Capital Management 商讨该私募股权公司如何为其 7.6 亿美元的收购出价提供资金，使其摆脱破产困境。【原文：Lenders to discount retailer Big Lots Inc. are talking to Nexus Capital Management about how the private equity firm would finance its $760 million bid to buy the company and bring it out of bankruptcy.】

item.title: 债券市场面临通胀低于美联储目标的危险
item.description: 美联储与通胀的斗争已经进行了两年，债券投资者看到了新的风险：消费者价格正在过度降温。【原文：Two years into the Federal Reserve’s battle against inflation, bond investors are seeing a new risk: Consumer prices are cooling too much.】

item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.【原文：At Goldman Sachs Group Inc., there’s an ESG filter that tells investors to buy coal giant Glencore Plc, and avoid Big Tech staples Microsoft Corp. and Alphabet Inc.】

item.title: 收购公司 GTCR 正就收购德国制药商 Stada 进行深入谈判
item.description: 据知情人士透露，收购公司 GTCR 正在就可能收购德国仿制药制造商 Stada Arzneimittel AG 进行深入谈判。【原文：Buyout firm GTCR is in advanced talks on a potential acquisition of German generic drugmaker Stada Arzneimittel AG, people with knowledge of the matter said.】

item.title: 埃克森首席执行官誓言：如果激进分子 "滥用 "代理规则，将起诉更多激进分子
item.description: 埃克森美孚公司（Exxon Mobil Corp.）的高级管理人员誓言，如果更多激进投资者继续 "滥用 "代理投票程序，他将对其提起诉讼，而就在几个月前，针对 Arjuna Capital LLC 的诉讼被联邦法官驳回。【原文：Exxon Mobil Corp.’s top executive vowed to sue more activist investors if they continue to “abuse” the proxy voting process, just months after a lawsuit against Arjuna Capital LLC was dismissed by a federal judge.】
